description.narrative: PIMS 3744 - Manejo Ambientalmente Racional y Disposición Bifenilos Policlorados en Argentina

activity-description.narrative: Reducir el riesgo de las emisiones de bifenilos policlorados y la exposición de la población y el medio ambiente a dichas sustancias

description.narrative: Development and implementation of a national PCB final disposal and destruction strategy
PCB final disposal and destruction strategy validated by national and provincial authorities

comment.narrative: National efforts to meet the obligations of the Stockholm Convention are weakened by the lack of coordination between national and provincial environmental authorities
A feasibility study with options for treatment decontamination and final disposal of PCBs validated by stakeholders and including funding options

The Project has conducted a study on the PCB disposal capacity at a national level including the technologies available on the local market This assessment included the technologies used infrastructure territorial scope and operational costs among other variables
Additionally during this period the Project collected information on new technologies for the treatment and end disposal of PCBs being used in Latin America

description.narrative: Initial consultations with the main stakeholders and continuous communications with the public at large
Communication plan with information and consultation meetings among stakeholders on the expected Project objectives and outcomes Number of meetings held and percentage of participants

comment.narrative: Environmental enforcement authorities in the provinces the small and medium ownersholders of PCBs and the large users of the electricity sector have little information on their responsibilities within the framework of the Stockholm Convention and the national legislation for identifying and eliminating PCB stocks
Local governments trained and informed about PCB environmental management and interested in becoming a part of the Project

The Project continued to implement the communication plan having 36 meetings with the main stakeholders including PCBs owners the electrical sector environmental authorities PCBs operators among others
Since its inception and until June 2015 the Project held meetings with local authorities from 15 provinces with the purpose of informing them about actions undertaken under the Project
As previously stated the Project has entered into agreements with 5 of these provinces where they commited to undertake necessary tasks to eliminate PCBs
Please note that the absence of such an agreement does not mean that the Province is unaware of the project or is not making efforts in that direction but that it improving the management of PCBs through other means

description.narrative: Environmental management plans implemented by companies of the electrical sector generation transportation and distribution companies and large users within the provinces

comment.narrative: There is a gap between compliance with the Stockholm Convention at the federal and provincial levels
Generation and distribution companies and large users within the provinces with PCB environmental management plans and a programme for their elimination

With regard to the two pilot provinces it should be noted that the cooperatives in Entre Rios are in the final stage of the PCB decontamination efforts throughout the provincial territory A bidding process is under way to contract an operator to dechlorinate the remaining 1021 contaminated units
In the case of Formosa one cooperative is already decontaminating 49 transformers summing a total of 16 tons and the other cooperative is surveying and sampling all of its transformers more than 1500
In these two provinces the Project has provided support and fundings in all tasks such as sampling transformers and decontaminating oils and equipment
Apart from the pilot provinces the Project has relevant gathered information from key actors in the electricity sector including ATEERA the Association of transporters of electricity and Projects cofunder which has purchased its own equipment to decontaminate transformers and has been doing so since 2010
Among the major electricity generators Centrales de la Costa Atlantica Project cofunder already has PCBfree equipment also large users in 11 provinces are exporting PCBs while local distributors in 6 provinces are carrying out transformer dechlorination activities
In all these stakeholders the Project has provided technical assistance and guidelines to ensure a rational sound management disposal of PCBs

description.narrative: Reduce the risk of PCB exposure and emissions for the population and the environment by strengthening PCB environmental management systems and eliminating contaminated oil and equipment currently being used or stored so as to meet the goal of eliminating 2000 tons of PCB in an environmentally friendly manner
Tons of PCBs eliminated tons and cost per ton

comment.narrative: The latest estimate based on information from control bodies and sectoral estimates amounts to 3515 tons of PCBs contaminated oil and equipment
Report on the elimination of 2000 tons of contaminated oil and equipment by project end indicating mode of destruction used and cost per ton

During this reporting period the Project can acredit dechlorination of 175000 litres of PCBcontaminated oil with a total of 700 tons of decontaminated wastes done by the Projects cofunders
In addition during this reporting period a total of 449 tons of PCB wastes were exported for final disposal to France consisting in 315 tons of capacitors 37 tons of contaminated oils3785 tons of more than 210 transformers and 2 tons of residues
Hence the Project can prove that since its inception and until June 30 2015 Argentina has decontaminated more than 8600 tons of which 1212 tons were exported to France for final disposal and over 7450 tons were decontaminated by private operators Of this total the 22 can be directly assigned to Projects efforts or cofunder activities
It should be noted that since 2013 particularly after the entry into force of SAyDS Resolution No 52214 there has been an exponential growth in the tonnage that was disposed of through exports
Within the scope of its objectives the project was directly involved in the drafting followup approval and effective implementation of the above resolution which simplified the export process

description.narrative: Strengthening of the institutional capacity of the national and provincial governments of Argentina and of large PCB ownersholders for a safe and environmentally sound management of and final disposal of PCBs
A sustainable training programme for large users from the electricity sector duly trained on PCBrelated risks and on PCB environmental management

comment.narrative: Large users of the electricity sector buildings and companies are not aware of the risks to health and the environment brought about by inappropriate PCB environmental management
Large users from the electricity sector duly trained on PCBrelated risks and on PCB environmental management

In this reporting period over 25 people from the electricity sector have been trained including authorities from electricity generation transportation and distribution companies as well as sector technicians and operators A total of 70 persons where trained since the Projects inception

description.narrative: A laboratory certification programme for PCB testing implemented through INTI

comment.narrative: Percentage of labs certified for PCBs
Registro de certified labs accredited for PCB analysis

A national survey has been completed the purpose of which was to learn about the technical capacities of laboratories for PCB analyses
A technical document has been drafted containing all survey results including an assessment of the situation
Following the projects strategic decision to encourage consensusbased technical developments a workshop was held in July with 15 major laboratories and other relevant government agencies so as to submit the document for discussion and include their experience and contributions Every year between 30 and 40 labs accredit PCBs analysis capacities in the National Institute of Industrial Technology Most of them belong to Buenos Aires The Projects efforts and strategy is to have accredited at least one lab in each region or province

description.narrative: Number of inspectors from the national environmental authority and from provincial enforcement authorities duly trained and implementing monitoring and control of PCB management

comment.narrative: There are regulations at the national level and in some provinces but no monitoring and control capacity by environmental authorities
Inspectors from the national environmental authority and from provincial enforcement authorities duly trained and implementing monitoring and control of PCB management

In this period more than 170 government agents have been trained in environmentally sound management including environmental authorities inspectors and environmental oversight officers A total of 230 persons where trained since the Projects inception

description.narrative: Reviewed and harmonized PCB legislation validated by the national and provincial governments

comment.narrative: There is a gap in policies technical guidelines institutional capacity and regulations between the national environmental authority and the provincial environmental enforcement authoritiesNonharmonization between the institutional capabilities and rules of the national and provincial environmental audits

Two provinces under the pilot project with environmental enforcement authorities that have the rules and institutional capacity to monitor and control the proper application of a PCB environmental management system

In 2014 the Project published and disseminated a compilation of regulations on PCBs at a national level and from all 24 provinces
Based on this compilation the Project is working in coordination with the Regulatory Authority of the Secretariat for Environment and Sustainable Development to develop a comparative analysis and a series of recommendations andor suggestions in order to change improve and strengthen the regulations in place

description.narrative: Temporary PCB storing sites at the local regional andor central levels duly set up and receiving technical support
Feasibility Studies for authorizing the operation of the temporary storing sites for PCB contaminated oil and equipment

comment.narrative: Since there are no regional storage sites it is not possible optimize PCB treatment and elimination costs
PCB regional storage sites duly established and accepted by users in the provinces for temporary storage

The Project has provided training technical resources and oversight to a temporary storing site for electrical equipment to be decontaminated in the Province of Rio Negro
In the Province of Entre Rios the project supported the adaptation of a storage site in the city of Concordia by providing materials and technical support
Also through an agreement with the Facultad de Ciencias de la Alimentacion de la Universidad de Entre Rios School of Food Science of the University of Entre Rios an additional environmental impact assessment and environmental baseline study were conducted for a site designated for decontamination of all the transformers in the province
In the Province of Formosa the Project has also helped with the adaptation of a site in the town of El Colorado where the transformers belonging to the provinces electricity distribution cooperatives will be stockpiled and decontaminated

description.narrative: Evaluación de los requerimientos para la construcción yo adecuación de depósitos temporales

comment.narrative: The possibility of storing PCB contaminated oil and equipment by small and medium sized generation and distribution companies is quite limited
Requerimientos para la construcción yo adecuación de depósitos temporales establecidos

The Project has developed a technical specifications manual for the design andor upgrading of sites used for the temporary storage of electrical transformers and PCB containers including the possibility of performing decontamination operations in order to ensure their environmentally sustainable managementThis manual was distributed to the provinces and is also available on the Projects website
